title: Median and Frequency
text: Note that in the "cumulative relative frequency" column we see the value $$0.52$$. The median is the 50th percentile or the second quartile. Therefore, we can count of the "frequency" column and find the midpoint.

title: Looking at the Frequency Column
text: There are $$50$$ total data points. How many data points will be less than the median?

title: Determining Median from the Frequency Column
text: Where is the 25th data point based on frequency?

subHints.title: Determining Median from the Frequency Column
subHints.text: How many data points (what is the sum of the frequencies) up to and including $$6$$ hours of sleep per school night?

subHints.title: Determining Median from the Frequency Column
subHints.text: How many data points (what is the sum of the frequencies) up to and including $$7$$ hours of sleep per school night?

title: Median Between 25th and 26th Data Point
text: Because there are an even number of total data points, we note that there will be $$\frac{50}{2}=25$$ data points below the median and $$\frac{50}{2}=25$$ data points above the median. Therefore, the median will be the middle point between the 25th and 26th data points.

subHints.title: 25th Data Point
subHints.text: The first $$14$$ data points reside in $$4$$ hours to $$6$$ hours of sleep per night. The first $$26$$ data points reside in $$4$$ hours to $$7$$ hours of sleep per night. This means that data points $$15$$ through $$26$$ reside in the $$7$$ hours of sleep per night category. Therefore, what is the 25th data point?

subHints.title: 26th Data Point
subHints.text: The first $$14$$ data points reside in $$4$$ hours to $$6$$ hours of sleep per night. The first $$26$$ data points reside in $$4$$ hours to $$7$$ hours of sleep per night. This means that data points $$15$$ through $$26$$ reside in the $$7$$ hours of sleep per night category. Therefore, what is the 26th data point?

title: Determining the Median
text: What is the middle point between the 25th and 26th data points?
